intro: Meliosma nesites, commonly known as the Neotropical meliosma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliosmaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves with a distinctive, often hairy underside. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-white in color, and it produces capsule fruits that contain minute seeds. Meliosma nesites plays a role in its local ecosystem as a food source for certain insects and as a component of forest understory vegetation.
